text:
often has no signs or symptoms. As the disease gets worse it can cause tiredness, changes in how you urinate (more often or less often), loss of appetite, nausea (feeling sick to the stomach), swelling in the hands or feet, itchiness or numbness, and trouble concentrating.",NHLBI,Atherosclerosis
How to diagnose Atherosclerosis ?,"Your doctor will diagnose atherosclerosis based on your medical and family histories, a physical exam, and test results.
